Klasse MapParser

java.lang.Object
viewmodel.MapParser
public class MapParser extends Object
Parses and renders the game map by processing the provided game data and populating the UI with tiles.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • MapParser

      public MapParser()

  • Methodendetails

    • setLogger

      public static void setLogger(Logger log)

    • renderGameMap

      public static void renderGameMap(List<List<List<GameStartedMessage.Field>>> gameMap, Client client, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane)
      Renders the game board by populating the provided GridPane with visual elements based on the gameMap. It adjusts cell sizes to fit within the specified VBox dimensions and overlays robot representations from the client.
      Parameter:
      gameMap - The game map parsed from the GameStartedMessage.
      client - The Client instance.
      gridPane - The grid pane used to display the map.

    • adjustCellSizes

      public static void adjustCellSizes(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane, int cols, int rows, double windowWidth, double windowHeight)
      Adjusts the sizes of the cells within a GridPane based on the specified number of columns, rows, and the dimensions of the window. Each cell is resized to ensure a uniform appearance, and any ImageView within a StackPane child is adjusted to fit the new cell size.
      Parameter:
      gridPane - the GridPane whose cell sizes are to be adjusted
      cols - the number of columns in the grid
      rows - the number of rows in the grid
      windowWidth - the total width of the window
      windowHeight - the total height of the window

    • renderGameWithRobots

      public static void renderGameWithRobots(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane, Client client)
      Renders the game board with robots by placing them onto the specified GridPane. It retrieves robot information from the client and uses the RobotRenderer to display each robot on the board. Additionally, it creates and stores RobotModel instances for each robot in the client's internal map.
      Parameter:
      gridPane - the GridPane representing the game board where robots will be rendered
      client - the client containing robot data and methods for managing robot models

    • updateEnergySpace

      public static void updateEnergySpace(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane, int x, int y)
      Updates the image of an Energy-Space tile when a player lands on it.
      Parameter:
      gridPane - The GridPane representing the game board.
      x - The x-coordinate of the tile.
      y - The y-coordinate of the tile.

    • removeStartingPoint

      public static void removeStartingPoint(int takenX, int takenY, BaseClient client, int clientID)
      Removes a starting point button from the specified coordinates on the game board. If the provided client ID matches the current client, all buttons on the board will be disabled.
      Parameter:
      takenX - The x-coordinate of the starting point to be removed.
      takenY - The y-coordinate of the starting point to be removed.
      client - The client instance that holds the game board reference.
      clientID - The ID of the client.

    • fireWallLasers

      public static void fireWallLasers(GameDataBridge dataBridge, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane, Client client)
      Fires lasers from predefined wall positions on the game board.
      Parameter:
      dataBridge - The data bridge containing the game state and laser positions.
      gridPane - The grid where the lasers should be rendered.
      client - The client executing the laser firing action.

    • renderRobotLasers

      public static void renderRobotLasers(List<List<List<GameStartedMessage.Field>>> gameMap, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane, Client client)
      Renders lasers fired by robots on the game board. This method retrieves the robot positions and directions, then calls the laser rendering function.
      Parameter:
      gameMap - The game board map containing all game elements.
      gridPane - The grid where the robot lasers should be rendered.
      client - The client controlling the robots.

    • updateWallLaserMap

      public static void updateWallLaserMap(List<List<List<GameStartedMessage.Field>>> gameMap, GameDataBridge dataBridge)
      Updates the mapping of wall lasers in the game map.

      This method scans the game map for laser positions that are blocked by walls. If a laser faces a wall in the opposite direction, its position and orientation are stored in a temporary map.

      Parameter:
      gameMap - The game map.
      dataBridge - The instance to store the updated wall laser map.

    • getCheckpointNumber

      public int getCheckpointNumber()

    • getRestartPointOrientation

      public static Direction getRestartPointOrientation()

    • animatePushPanels

      public static void animatePushPanels(GameDataBridge dataBridge, String pushPanelType)
      Activates animation for a given push panel type.
      Parameter:
      dataBridge - The instance that holds game data, including the game board.
      pushPanelType - The type of push panel to animate.

    • moveCheckpoints

      public static void moveCheckpoints(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane, List<List<List<GameStartedMessage.Field>>> gameMap, int checkpointID, int newRow, int newCol)
      Moves a checkpoint on the game board to a new position and updates the grid pane and game map accordingly.
      Parameter:
      gridPane - The grid pane representing the game board.
      gameMap - The game map.
      checkpointID - The checkpoint ID.
      newRow - The row index where the checkpoint should be moved.
      newCol - The column index where the checkpoint should be moved.
